title: The executable file makes a unique ID from each individual PC. Can anyone decipher from where the file makes these unique IDs?
content:
The file generates random unique ID. It says hardware ID but I couldn't find it in product key, BIOS serial number or anywhere. I used IDA but I couldn't get from where the file creates the code. Even a little help would be a great deal for me.

No need to install, it's 3 mb portable.

Link: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1JqkRXUvAha13WpfFaeGMHig_GnAZHJab

comments.text: Please clearly describe the problem you are having, using relevant technical details. The scope of the problem as currently described is too broad.

In simple words...Well the executable file picks up the unique ID from the PC hardware.So the ID is different on each PC as each PC have different product key or HWID or BIOS serial....I wanted know from where does it takes the ID from i.e from product key of OS or HWID or BIOS serial etc...From IDA can we know from where does the executable takes the ID ? If yes then how ?

@WORM hi and welcome to RE.SE. Generally, yes, it's possible to investigate this. However, you should show a minimum of initiative and tell us what you have tried so far. As it stands your question may be too broad to answer.

answers_data.content: You can start from the message that prints the Hardware ID and work backwards from it to see how exactly it is calculated.

comments.text: The string with the message is not there...What shall i do ?
